text: We started by interviewing stakeholders across four departments to understand how they use the existing dashboard and where they get stuck. The biggest pain point was the lack of customization â€” every team saw the same default view regardless of their role.

Based on our research findings, we designed a role-based dashboard system that surfaces the most relevant metrics for each user type. Technical users see detailed system health data, while business stakeholders see high-level KPIs and trends.

We validated the new designs through three rounds of usability testing. The final iteration reduced the average time to find key metrics from 45 seconds to under 10 seconds. The modular widget system also allowed teams to create custom views without engineering support.

Field workers told us their biggest frustration was losing work when connectivity dropped. We designed an offline-first architecture where all data entry happens locally and syncs automatically when a connection becomes available.
The task management interface was simplified to three core actions: start job, record data, and complete job. Each action was designed to work with gloved hands on a 5-inch screen in bright sunlight.

After launch, field completion rates increased by 34% and the average time per task decreased by 20%. Workers reported significantly less frustration with the new mobile experience compared to the previous desktop-only workflow.
